across folded brim when laid flat or any other bulky weight yarn that achieves gauge 8in / 20cm 10in / 25 5cm 12in / 30 5cm gauge 9 row and 8 5 sts = 2 in 5cm in 1x1 rib abbreviations notions k = knit 6mm circular needles 16 in p = purl 6mm double pointed needles dpns ssk = slip slip knit insert right needle through first tapestry needle stitch on left needle as if to knit and slip_stitch from stitch marker left to right needle do the same to next stitch on left needle insert left needle through both stitches on right needle and knit together for a visual instruction see this tutorial by com/kniteweup written instructions cast on 64 72 80 sts i suggest using a stretchy cast on like the german twisted method but a regular cast on will also work work 1 x 1 rib k1 p1 for 8 9 10 in 20 23 25 5 cm crown decrease note -- work sts as they appear means knit the knits and purl the purls round 1 *ssk work 6 sts as they appear* repeat from * to * around 8 9 10 sts decreased round 2 and every even row work every stitch as it appears round 3 *ssk work 5 sts as they appear* repeat from * to * around 8 9 10 sts decreased continue in this manner working one less st in every decrease chunk until 8 18 20 sts remain switch to dpns when sts are too tight for circulars next row medium and large only ssk around 9 10 sts remain break yarn weave through live sts and pull tight weave in ends and block folding brim up to preferred size pattern designed and written by emerson rogers of knit ewe up contact kniteweup@gmail com for any questions this pattern is not intended for commercial use
